tweet: Here's the script: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ethereum/genesis_block_generator/master/mk_genesis_block.py … Doesn't work anymore because many block explorers have shut down, but you get the idea. Also ensures full transparency of the distribution; no way to hide secret premines.
The 50k also doesn't prove data availability. Data availability is super important, people!https://github.com/ethereum/research/wiki/A-note-on-data-availability-and-erasure-coding …

In fact, you can do even better. A script to calculate the genesis block is released *at time of sale*, and it's agreed that an ethereum block hash with a height that's a multiple of 500000 is needed as a nonce. The developer just writes software, community launches when ready.

This seems backwards. Why can't third parties just run a script to scan the BTC/ETH blockchains, see how much everyone contributed, calculate how much XTZ everyone should get, and generate the genesis block without Tezos Co involvement? That's how the Ethereum launch worked.

@ skrobtrace, I’d love for you to find one other person who’s made the analogy of XRP articles about Ripple being equivalent to Bitcoin articles about Coinbase. I’ll wait.

It’s a universal settlement asset. You’ve probably never had to wire money anywhere if you aren’t familiar with how awful correspondent banking is. People who send money back home lose so much in fees. It’s terrible.https://tiffanyhayden.blog/2018/06/06/what-is-ripple/ …
They gave me back the Bitcoin that I already owned. It was worth quite a bit more when I sent it to them. They would have made out well had they actually filled my order.

It’s also fair to note that we don’t know how much Bitcoin or ETH somebody like Coinbase holds. The people behind Coinbase could hold a majority of both and we have no way to know. It is only XRP that we can be sure of because Ripple chooses to be transparent. I commend that.

Every month, there is a set amount released. It’s not sold on the open market. Ripple can use it to for strategic partnerships if they are available. If not, whatever isn’t used is put back into another escrow at the end of the month. (2/2)

Well, another way to look at this is that Ripple has more skin in the game than anybody else. When XRP increases just one penny, Ripple earns $600 MILLION. They have more drive to create value than anyone. Also, because others share your concern, XRP was placed in escrow. (1/2)

SWIFT is the single access point to international banking. It’s used as an economic weapon. Getting cut off means losing access to the world. @ Ripple has built an open network that will eviscerate SWIFT’s walled garden. (2/2) $ XRPhttps://nulltx.com/ripple-vs-the-establishment/ …
